content:
I updated my IG Publisher jar and now all of my builds get stock just after the "Processing Conformance Resources" log:

onLoad:
Root directory: /Users/jeanduteau/Documents/DDIWork/IBM-BEST/datastandards (00:09.0415)
Core Package hl7.fhir.r4.core#4.0.1
Terminology Cache is at /Users/jeanduteau/Documents/DDIWork/IBM-BEST/datastandards/input-cache/txcache. 4 files in cache (00:14.0289)
Connect to Terminology Server at http://tx.fhir.org (00:14.0909)
Load Package hl7.fhir.pubpack#0.0.6
Load Package hl7.fhir.xver-extensions#0.0.4
Initialization complete (00:16.0497)
Load Content (00:16.0498)
Processing Conformance Resources (00:16.0842)

I'm just going to let it sit here in case whatever is going just takes a really long time. But I thought I'd raise it here in case some unknown system is down.
Okay, it has moved past it now, so it was nothing.

I have exactly the same problem since I updated locally to version 1.101 of publisher at 8 am UTC+2 this morning. On my computer it gets stuck after "Load content" forever. And in the continuous integration it ends up in a failure at the same point. See my topic "new release 1.101 fails" earlier.
